required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety And Efficacy of Sofosbuvir/Velpatasvir/Voxilaprevir Fixed-Dose Combination for 12 Weeks in Adults Who Participated in a Prior Gilead-Sponsored HCV Treatment Study
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Safety And Efficacy of Sofosbuvir/Velpatasvir/Voxilaprevir Fixed-Dose Combination for 12 Weeks in Subjects Who Participated in a Prior Gilead-Sponsored HCV Treatment Study

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objectives of this study are to determine the efficacy, safety, and tolerability of treatment with sofosbuvir/velpatasvir/voxilaprevir (SOF/VEL/VOX) fixed-dose combination (FDC) for 12 weeks in participants with chronic hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection with or without cirrhosis, who did not achieve sustained viral response (SVR) after receiving prior treatment in a Gilead-sponsored HCV treatment study of direct-acting antiviral (DAA)-containing regimens.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response (SVR) 12 Weeks After Discontinuation of Therapy (SVR12)
primary_outcome.description: SVR12 was defined as HCV RNA < the lower limit of quantitation (LLOQ; ie, 15 IU/mL) at 12 weeks after stopping study treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Permanently Discontinued Any Study Drug Due to an Adverse Event

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With SVR at 4 Weeks After Discontinuation of Therapy (SVR4)
secondary_outcome.description: SVR4 was defined as HCV RNA < LLOQ at 4 weeks after stopping study treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With HCV RNA < LLOQ On Treatment
Percentage of Participants With Virologic Failure
secondary_outcome.description: Virologic failure was defined as: On-treatment virologic failure: Breakthrough (confirmed HCV RNA ≥ LLOQ after 2 consecutive HCV RNA < LLOQ), or Rebound (confirmed > 1 log10 IU/mL increase in HCV RNA from nadir while on treatment), or Non-response (HCV RNA persistently ≥ LLOQ through 8 weeks of treatment) Virologic relapse: Confirmed HCV RNA ≥ LLOQ during the posttreatment period having achieved HCV RNA < LLOQ at last on-treatment visit

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in HCV RNA

intervention.description: 400/100/100 mg FDC tablet administered orally once daily with food

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronically HCV-infected males and non-pregnant/non-lactating females aged 18 years or older who did not achieve sustained virologic response (SVR) in a prior Gilead-sponsored HCV treatment study
Note: Other protocol defined Inclusion/Exclusion criteria may apply.

facility.name: Emory Hospital Midtown Infectious Disease Clinic
Saint Louis University, Gastroenterology & Hepatology, Clinical Research Unit
Columbia University Medical Center/ New York Presbyterian
New Orleans Center for Clinical Research
Toronto Centre for Liver Disease (TCLD), Toronto General Hospital

results_reference.citation: Ruane P, Strasser SJ, Gane EJ, Hyland RH, Shao J, Dvory-Sobol H, et al. Retreatment with Sofosbuvir/Velpatasvir/Voxilaprevir for 12 weeks is safe and effective for patients who have previously received Sofosbuvir/Velpatasvir or Sofosbuvir/Velpatasvir/Voxilaprevir [Abstract LBO-06]. 16th International Symposium on Viral Hepatitis and Liver Diseases (ISVHLD); 2018 14-17 June; Toronto, Canada

patient_data.ipd_description: Qualified external researchers may request IPD for this study after study completion. For more information, please visit our website at https://www.gilead.com/about/ethics-and-code-of-conduct/policies.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: A secured external environment with username, password, and RSA code.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were enrolled at study sites in North America, Europe, New Zealand, and Australia. The first participant was screened on 25 April 2017. The last study visit occurred on 19 March 2018.

group.title: SOF/VEL/VOX
group.description: Sofosbuvir/velpatasvir/voxilaprevir (SOF/VEL/VOX) (400/100/100 mg) fixed-dose combination (FDC) tablet once daily for 12 weeks

baseline.population: Safety Analysis Set included all participants who took at least 1 dose of study drug.

group.title: SOF/VEL/VOX
group.description: SOF/VEL/VOX (400/100/100 mg) FDC tablet once daily for 12 weeks

measure.title: IL28b Status
measure.description: The CC, CT, and TT alleles are different forms of the IL28b gene.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Sustained Virologic Response (SVR) 12 Weeks After Discontinuation of Therapy (SVR12)
outcome.description: SVR12 was defined as HCV RNA < the lower limit of quantitation (LLOQ; ie, 15 IU/mL) at 12 weeks after stopping study treatment.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set included all enrolled participants who took at least 1 dose of study drug.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse Events: Up to 12 weeks plus 30 days; All-Cause Mortality: Up to Posttreatment Week 12
reported_events.desc: Safety Analysis Set included all participants who took at least 1 dose of study drug.

group.title: SOF/VEL/VOX
group.description: SOF/VEL/VOX (400/100/100 mg) fixed-dose combination (FDC) tablet once daily for 12 weeks

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: After conclusion of the study and without prior written approval from Gilead, investigators in this study may communicate, orally present, or publish in scientific journals or other media only after the following conditions have been met: The results of the study in their entirety have been publicly disclosed by or with the consent of Gilead in an abstract, manuscript, or presentation form; or The study has been completed at all study sites for at least 2 years
